context_section.paragraph: The idea for {{app_name}} was born from a personal observation. As a front-end developer in an agile team, I couldn't find a planning poker app that was elegant, free, and ad-free. I thought it would make a great side project. So I embarked on this adventure with no financial goal, just for the fun of it.
context_section.subtitle: A word from the creator
context_section.title: A bit of context

free_feature_card.description: The application is completely free, with no limit on sessions or votes.
free_feature_card.title: Free

no_ad_feature_card.description: No advertisements will disrupt your team planning experience.
no_ad_feature_card.title: Ad-free

no_registration_feature_card.description: No registration is required to use all the features.
no_registration_feature_card.title: No registration

how_it_works_section.paragraph: Planning poker, also known as Scrum poker, is a collaborative estimation technique used by agile teams. Each team member secretly chooses a card representing their estimate of the effort required for a task. Once everyone has voted, the cards are revealed simultaneously to facilitate discussion and reach a consensus.
how_it_works_section.subtitle: The concept
how_it_works_section.title: How does it work?

why_choose_us_section.sub_subtitle: How does {{app_name}} compare to other online Planning poker applications?
why_choose_us_section.subtitle: The comparison
why_choose_us_section.title: Why choose {{app_name}}?

why_use_it_section.paragraph: Planning poker helps avoid anchoring bias where one person's opinion influences others. By revealing estimates simultaneously, each member shares their perspective independently. This{" "} fosters constructive discussions and leads to more accurate and consensual estimates.
why_use_it_section.subtitle: The benefits
why_use_it_section.title: Why use it?
